alert.note: Alert for Pecos (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 02 at 2:23PM CDT until June 02 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... * Until 245 PM CDT. * At 222 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 21 miles east of Fort Stockton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed tornado. Tornado was located south of mile marker 280 on I-10. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Pecos County. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 278 and 290. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
